page.title: 02ECOLOGY OF FORDYCE AREA
page.content:
-TREES-
In the village the trees are mostly deciduous. Around our school there are many different types of fully grown trees, e.g. Lime, Elm, Beech, Sycamore, Oak, Ash, Whitebeam, Maple, Horsechestnut and Sweetchestnut.Young Rowan and Whitebeam trees grow at the "Bleachy",a picturesque amenity area planted out in 1976/77.Also growing there, beside the Fordyce Burn,are Elderberry, Willow, Sycamore and Laburnum. Our survey showed that Sycamore and Maple were the trees grown mainly in Fordyce, but the wooded areas i.e. Greenhill Plantation, Cottonhill, Towie Wood, Hillend Plantation and Fordyce Hill Plantation are mainly of Spruce and Firwoods.Copper Beeches are to be found at the Old Manse.
